metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23973 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
When trying to load a cross-origin resource in an audio/video context a decoding error may have resulted, and the content of that error may have revealed information about the resource. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86, Thunderbird < 78.8, and Firefox ESR < 78.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23973` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
